page.title: 13SHELTON & OXON CHURCH.
page.content: The church is called Christ Church. It was built in the year 1854. It was built on an area of land known as Windmill Field. The church was built firstly, because the local population had increased and secondly, the parishoners had previously walked to St. Chad's which was a long distance away. The church was built in the Early English style. The stone came locally from Cardeston. The dressing stones also came locally, from Grinshill. It was built to seat 250 people and served the 3 townships of Shelton and Oxon, Crowmeole, and Woodcote and Morton. The church was consecrated on October 3rd, 1854. The word Shelton comes from the word "scelf", meaning shelf or sloping ground and "ton", a farm or enclosure. Therefore Shelton means farm for Oxon, or "Ox Hill".
